desc: I just started a video sharing site using clipshare. Unfortunately clipshare does not come with the option to put the site on maintenance mode.1) I want to put the site on maintenance mode, or coming soon notice. I prefer a solution easy toimplement.2) I want to be able to work on my site from home and any other location, using any laptop, tablet, or computer.3) I want to be able to switch back and forth between maintenance mode and "regular" in the lesspainful way possible.Here is what I did so far. Perhaps there is a better way to do it.-Somebody helped me put a password on the site, but it didn't work well, as I was unable to seechanges I made in clipshare' cpanel, published to the website. so I gave up on this solution. Perhaps itwas not done right.-Right now, with some help, I did some change to my .htaccess, so I could work on my site, but onlyfrom home! Using one specific IP address. So, I can't work on my site in a library, a cafe or any otherplace. This solution does not let me see how my site looks like as seen from other devices.4) I am open to any suggestion or improvement.This could be the beginning of a fruitful collaboration.
title: Maintenance and coming soon mode

desc: Hi!We are looking for curious and open-minded photographers enthusiast to expand their skill set in 'photogrammetry', a process of taking a series of overlapping images to produce a 3D representation of a subject, and to make a bit of money on the side!Scan the World is a community-built archive of 3D printable objects of cultural significance. Every object in the archive originates from photogrammetry scan data before being optimized for 3D printing.We are looking for freelance photographers to join us in our goal to digitize sculptures, cultural artifacts and other pieces to spread 3D printable culture all over the world!We look forward to hearing from you.
title: Take some Photos of Statues

desc: I know my wedding is soon, but I just decided that I really want a video of my wedding after all. Previously, I wasnt interested because I had seen so many that just seemed like all they showed were the bride and groom posing for pictures trying to look like models which i thought is pretty silly to film. So what I would like is for it to be more personal and capturing real moments. - aka we don’t want the videographer filming us taking posed pictures. We want to have him/her capturing actual  moments from the ceremony, cocktail hour and reception. We want to make sure parts of our ceremony and the vows are captured with us speaking in the video, not just us mouthing them with music played over that which i have seen a lot of. During the time we are taking those posed pics, we would love it if our videographer could be meeting our guests and capture their well wishes to us.  We don’t want to be the only people in our wedding video, it should show everyone who came and capture the great time they had at the reception. Also, we would like all of the speeches/toasts captured with audio (not played over with music).  We would like to look back at what they said one day and see the great time we had. please let me know if you can do this for us. Thanks so much.
title: wedding videographer needed asap

desc: So here is the task:We need you to re-create the 4 videos shown in this link: [url removed, login to view]The videos that you see are currently shown inside the Facebook mobile app. We need to adjust these so that the interface resembles the Facebook mobile site (like visiting [url removed, login to view] on your phone).The moves that you show in your animations will be exactly same as shown in the videos we sent:1. scroll to a post Jack's Bowling Alley that says "Half price bowling this weekend!"2. then switch from the Sarah Thompson page to a Page called Dowtown Bike Rental3. then like the post4. then switch to Sarah's Ice Cream Parlor5. then click on the post and leave a comment (as shown in the videos)The only difference will be that this all takes place on the mobile website (versus the app, as shown in the videos we have), so please tweak the interface and the animations so that it looks like the Facebook mobile website.One thing to note, as the animations scroll through the Newsfeed, can you replace the ad in the current videos with the header "Facebook market place community" (it's right beneath the main post / Jack's Bowling Alley) with a generic ad (please see the attached ad)Please read and let me know if you have any questions. If this makes sense to you, please get started ASAP. We have a tight deadline and please keep us updated with your progress (send the videos as you complete them).We might be able to provide an After Effects raw file if that would help re-create and adjust these animations
title: Animation of website and mobile interface
